physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At birth, the patient presented with micropenis and undescended testes. At 15 months, he had normal GH response, normal cortisol response, normal free T4, and undetectable gonadotropins. Ultrasound revealed both testes and bilateral hydroceles.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial findings included bilateral cryptorchidism and micropenis noted at birth, with progressive weight gain and height increase observed up to age 9.7 years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: DHEA-S: 1385 Âµg/l, Testosterone: 0.15 ng/ml pre-hCG, 0.45 ng/ml post-hCG; Androstenedione: 0.17 ng/ml.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Response to hCG stimulation showed a limited testosterone response.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Repeat endocrine evaluation showed poor gonadotropin response to LHRH stimulation: LH 0.7 IU/liter, FSH 0.2 IU/liter to 1.8 IU/liter after 60 min; suboptimal testosterone response to hCG.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Endocrine evaluation at 10 years showed continued deficiencies in gonadotropin response and limited testosterone response.
